intro: Gloriosa minor, commonly known as the dwarf flame vine, is a climbing herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its striking, curling, flame-like flowers that range in color from orange to red. The plant has slender, woody stems and heart-shaped, dark green leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sun for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
